arm_group.description: Visual distortion increment based on the gait pattern

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the possibility of gait pattern change via visual
      feedback among patients with stroke. Also, the optimal visual feedback would be chosen from
      this study.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gait Control of Stroke Patients Using Visual Feedback

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Hemiplegic stroke patients >= 18 years old

          -  Functional Ambulation Category >=3

          -  Cognitively intact enough to follow the study protocol

          -  Adults without any gait problem

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Quadriplegic stroke patients

          -  Orthopedic problems to affect gait

          -  Underlying other neurological or psychological disorders

          -  Spasticity or contracture which impede the gait.

          -  Uncontrolled medical problems

          -  Pregnant.

intervention.intervention_name: Visual distortion increment based on the gait pattern

authority: Korea: Ministry of Food and Drug Safety
Korea: Ministry for Health, Welfare and Family Affairs

primary_outcome.description:
Step length symmetry during treadmill gait. When the participants walk on the treadmill, the walk symmetry was calculated from the sensor attached to them.
During the whole period of treadmill gait, step length asymmetry will be recorded.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of treadmill gait, an expected average of 15 minutes

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
